context: the patient is a 10-month-old baby with a history of a bilateral cleft of the lip and palate.
preoperative diagnoses: bilateral cleft lip and bilateral cleft of the palate.
preoperative diagnoses: bilateral cleft lip and bilateral cleft of the palate.

text: repair of bilateral cleft of the palate with vomer flaps
context: procedure performed: repair of bilateral cleft of the palate with vomer flaps.

text: stable, extubated, and transferred to the recovery room in stable condition
context: condition of the patient at the end of the procedure: stable, extubated, and transferred to the recovery room in stable condition.
the patient proceeded to have bilateral pe tube placement by dr. x, from ear, nose, and throat surgery.
the operative area was infiltrated with lidocaine with epinephrine 1:200,000, a total of 3 ml
a prophylactic dose of antibiotics was given.
hemostasis was achieved with help of electrocautery and surgicel.

this was approximated on both sides with 5-0 chromic running and interrupted stitches
then 2 stitches of 4-0 vicryl were applied to the soft palate in the delaire manner
a single stitch after infiltration of lidocaine without epinephrine at the level of the midline of the tongue was applied with 2-0 silk to the dorsal aspect of the tongue
and attached to the right cheek with a piece of tegaderm.
bss is applied to the eye after removing the tegaderm.
